alert.note: Alert for Redwood (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 9:34PM CDT until May 16 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County. .Accumulating rainfall has occurred across southern Minnesota Friday night into this evening. Totals so far have reached 2 to even 4 plus inches in some localized areas with additional rainfall expected tonight. This has caused river levels in this region to rapidly rise. Crests should occur within the next few days before a dry pattern this coming week allows for rivers to decrease again. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Redwood River near Redwood Falls. * WHEN...From Monday morning to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Low lying areas, mainly farmland, and some roads along the river begin to experience flooding; bottom of Swayback bridge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM CDT Saturday, the stage was 4.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.0 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 06/22/2011. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
